content.description: Three identical spheres are thrown from the same height above the ground. Sphere X is thrown vertically up, sphere Y is thrown horizontally, and sphere Z is thrown vertically down, as shown in figures 1, 2, and 3 above, respectively. All three spheres are thrown with the same speed. Air resistance is negligible.
content.question: Which sphere or spheres initially collide with the ground with the greatest speed?

choices.label: All three spheres collide with the same speed.

content.answer: All three spheres collide with the same speed.

skill.text: 2.C: Compare physical quantities between two or more scenarios or at different times and locations in a single scenario.
